CYICE
Class ICEInputStream

java.lang.Object
  CYICE.ICEInputStream

public class ICEInputStream
extends java.lang.Object

ICEInputStream : A class providing Read functions that return different data types.

Constructor Summary
ICEInputStream()
           The standard input (System.in) is used for creating this ICEInputStream instance.
ICEInputStream(java.lang.String file)
           The file named <file> is used for creating this ICEInputStream instance.
ICEInputStream(java.lang.String str, boolean strAsInputSource)
           If <strAsInputSource> then <str> is used as the source of input (i.e., we are to input from this string) else <str> is used as the file name for creating this ICEInputStream instance (i.e., we are to input from the file with this file name)

        (i.e., we are to input from this string)
 else <str> is used as the file name for creating this ICEInputStream instance

Method Detail

SeekNextValidString

public boolean SeekNextValidString()
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
 Perform a "seek" operation for (the remaining part of) this input stream until a valid 
 input string is found.  A valid input string is defined to be a sequence of 
 non-white-space characters.
 Return either true or false, depending on whether such a string is found.
 If false is returned, it means that the remaininbg part of this input stream is
 composed of white space characters (followed by an end-of-file marker).
 Example usage : if ( in.SeekNextValidString() ) // there IS a string to be read in
                   str = in.ReadString() ;       // so read it in (in is an ICEInputStream)

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

AtEOF

public boolean AtEOF()
              throws java.lang.Exception
 Whether the end-of-file situation has been encountered.
 If return true,
    then it must be end-of-file already;
 If return false,
    then it is now known whether it is end-of-file already or not;
 Example usage : if ( in.AtEOF() ) ... ;  // 'in' is an ICEInputStream

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

AtEOLN

public boolean AtEOLN()
               throws java.lang.Throwable
 Whether the end-of-line situation has been encountered (i.e., whether
 the next-char-to-be-read-in is '\n').
 If there is no next-char-to-be-read-in, AtEOLN() returns true ;
 If AtEOLN() returns 'false', it is guaranteed that there must be a
 next-char to be read in ;
 Be aware that, if the last-char-read is '\n' or ReadInputLine() has just been
 executed, the execution of AtEOLN() will lead to "force read" (i.e., waiting 
 for the user to enter something followed by hitting the ENTER key) ; 
 Example usage : if ( ! in.AtEOLN() ) // 'in' is an ICEInputStream
                  ... ;               // you can "read in a char" here without 
                                      // encountering any problem

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadInputLine

public java.lang.String ReadInputLine()
                               throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return (the rest of) the entire input-line of text.
 If it is already end-of-file when this function is called, an exception will
 be thrown ;
 otherwise, return the rest of the input before the next end-of-line char ; 
 (Note : if there is no more end-of-line char, then Trouble!!!)
 A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), 
 a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a 
 linefeed. 
 Example usage : String str = in.ReadInputLine();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadInputLine

public boolean ReadInputLine(StringObj inputLine)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return (the rest of) the entire input-line of text.
 If it is already end-of-file when this function is called, 
   'false' is returned and inputLine.val is set to 'null';
 otherwise, 'true' is returned and inputLine.val is set to be the
 rest of the input before the next end-of-line char ; 
 (Note : if there is no more end-of-line char, then Trouble!!!)
 A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), 
 a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a 
 linefeed. 
 It is assumed that <inputLine> must point to a StringObj instance.
 Example usage : if ( in.ReadInputLine( strObj ) ) // in is an ICEInputStream
                   System.out.println( "line : " + strObj.val );
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadString

public java.lang.String ReadString()
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return the next input string of text (terminated by a white-space character).
 If there is no valid input string before end-of-file, an exception will be thrown.
 Example usage : String str = in.ReadString();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadBoolean

public boolean ReadBoolean()
                    throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return the next input boolean-text (either "true" or "false") as a boolean.
 If the next input string is neither "true" nor "false", an exception will be thrown.
 Example usage : boolean isValid = in.ReadBoolean();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadChar

public char ReadChar()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return the next input character.
 If it is already end-of-file, then an exception will be thrown.
 Example usage : char ch = in.ReadChar();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadChar

public boolean ReadChar(CharObj charObj)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return the next input character.
 If it is already end-of-file, 
   then charObj.val is set to '\0' and 'false' is returned.
 It is assumed that <charObj> must point to a CharObj instance.
 Example usage : if ( in.ReadChar( charObj )  // in is an ICEInputStream
                    System.out.print("Input char : " + charObj.val);
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

ReadInt

public int ReadInt()
            throws java.lang.Throwable
 Return the next input integer-string as an integer.
 If there is no such input string, an exception will be thrown
 Example usage : int num = in.ReadInt();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

public long ReadLong()
              throws java.lang.Throwable

 Example usage : long num = in.ReadLong();  // in is an ICEInputStream
 
 Caution! Tab-charcters may be ignored and considered to be "non-existent".
